essayModels.question: 'Life is better today than it was 100 years ago.' Do you agree?

introduction.listing: Nowadays, there is considerable debate about whether life today is better than in the past.
introduction.opinion: From my perspective, modern life is significantly better
introduction.argument: due to remarkable advances in health, entertainment and communication.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: I firmly believe that healthcare plays an essential role
body.argument: in improving our lives. This is because diseases that once killed millions can now be treated effectively. For example, vaccines have eliminated deadly illnesses like polio and smallpox. As a result, life expectancy has increased dramatically worldwide.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: entertainment options have expanded enormously.
body.argument: This is because streaming platforms provide unlimited access to films and music instantly. For instance, we can enjoy any content from home at any time. Consequently, people have far more ways to relax and enjoy themselves.

body.listing: On the other hand, as as far as I can judge
body.opinion: While some argue this causes stress, I believe
body.argument: technology has transformed how we communicate globally. Video calls allow families to stay connected across continents daily. The benefits of instant global communication far outweigh any drawbacks.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: I am convinced that life today is much better than a century ago.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that improvements in health, entertainment and technology demonstrate remarkable human progress.

essayModels.question: Is it better to earn a lot of money or to enjoy your job?
writingPoints: how much time is spent at work
the type of work which is done
job satisfaction and mental health (your own idea)

introduction.listing: Few people would deny that work is an essential part of modern life.
introduction.argument: Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of both options.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: The main advantage of earning a high salary is
body.argument: financial security and stability. This is because well-paid workers can afford comfortable lifestyles and support their families. For example, they can pay for quality healthcare and education. Another strong point is that we spend nearly a third of our lives working, so earning good money makes those hours worthwhile.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: While there are many advantages to high salaries, job satisfaction matters greatly too.
body.argument: The key disadvantage of focusing only on money is that personal happiness suffers considerably. For instance, boring or stressful jobs often lead to unhappiness regardless of salary.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: mental health is significantly affected by job satisfaction.
body.argument: This is because unfulfilling work can cause burnout, anxiety and depression. Consequently, finding meaningful work protects our overall wellbeing.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: both money and enjoyment have clear advantages.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that finding work that provides both purpose and reasonable income would be the ideal solution.

essayModels.question: 'We should do everything we can to save animals which are in danger of disappearing from our planet.' Do you agree?
writingPoints: the kind of animals which are in danger
the reasons for protecting these animals

introduction.listing: In recent years, protecting endangered animals has attracted increasing attention
introduction.opinion: from both the public and environmental experts worldwide.
introduction.argument: I strongly believe that we should do everything possible to save them for future generations.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: many magnificent species are currently in serious danger of extinction.
body.argument: This is largely because hunting and habitat destruction have reduced their numbers drastically. For example, tigers, rhinos and elephants face critical threats. As a result, we are losing irreplaceable wildlife at an alarming rate.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: there are compelling reasons to protect these endangered animals.
body.argument: This is because every species plays vital roles in maintaining natural balance. For instance, bees pollinate crops that humans depend on for food. Consequently, losing animal species threatens our own survival too.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: ecosystem balance depends entirely on biodiversity.
body.argument: This is because each animal contributes to complex food chains. For example, wolves control deer populations and protect forests. Therefore, protecting wildlife maintains environmental stability for everyone.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: I firmly believe endangered animals must be protected urgently.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that conservation benefits both nature and humanity significantly.

essayModels.question: Which is more important â€“ friends or family?
writingPoints: who you can enjoy yourself with
who will help you when you have problems

introduction.listing: It is widely recognised that relationships are essential to our happiness and wellbeing.
introduction.argument: Hence, it is vital to consider the benefits of both.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: The main advantage of friends is
body.argument: that they provide enjoyment and shared interests. This is because we choose friends who share our hobbies, tastes and values. For example, teenagers select friends to socialise and have fun with. As a result, friendships create happiness and memorable experiences throughout life.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: While there are many advantages to friendships, family provides stronger support
body.argument: during difficult times. The key disadvantage of relying only on friends is that they may not always help during serious problems. In contrast, family members typically offer unconditional support during crises without hesitation.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: different relationships matter at different life stages.
body.argument: This is because teenagers often prioritise friends, while adults tend to value family more. Consequently, both types of relationships serve important purposes throughout our lives.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: both friends and family are extremely valuable.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that family support proves more reliable, but both contribute significantly to our happiness.

essayModels.question: Do you think the world's pollution problems can be solved?

introduction.listing: Nowadays, pollution has become an increasingly serious problem affecting the entire planet.
introduction.opinion: It is widely recognised that pollution damages health and the environment significantly.
introduction.argument: Hence, it is vital to examine the main problems and explore practical solutions.

body.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body.opinion: transport causes significant air pollution in cities worldwide.
body.argument: This is because millions of vehicles produce harmful emissions every single day. For example, major cities suffer from dangerous levels of smog. As a result, respiratory diseases are increasing among urban populations.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: rivers and seas are being contaminated by industrial waste and plastic.
body.argument: This happens because factories release toxic chemicals into waterways carelessly. For instance, countless marine animals die from plastic pollution annually. Consequently, entire ecosystems are being destroyed.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: renewable energy offers a very promising solution to these problems.
body.argument: This is because solar and wind power produce no harmful emissions whatsoever. For example, countries investing in clean energy report significantly improved air quality. If such measures were implemented globally, pollution could be reduced dramatically.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: I believe pollution can be addressed effectively through determined action.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that combining cleaner transport, stricter regulations and renewable energy will protect our planet.

essayModels.question: Is taking a gap year before university a good idea?

introduction.listing: Over the past few years, gap years have become increasingly popular among young people before university.
introduction.opinion: It is widely recognised that taking time off from education can have both positive and negative effects.
introduction.argument: Hence, it is vital to analyse the advantages and disadvantages carefully.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: The main advantage of gap years is gaining valuable life experience and independence.
body.argument: This is because travelling and volunteering abroad develop maturity and practical skills. For example, students who work overseas learn to solve problems independently. As a result, they often perform better when they return to education.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: While there are many advantages, gap years also present significant challenges.
body.argument: The key disadvantage of taking time off is potentially losing academic momentum and motivation. A major drawback is that study habits can deteriorate considerably after a year away. Consequently, some students struggle to return to education.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: financial considerations are extremely significant for many families.
body.argument: This is because travelling and accommodation require substantial savings. For instance, expenses can reach thousands of pounds. However, working during a gap year can help fund university studies later.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: gap years have both benefits and drawbacks.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that they benefit motivated students who plan carefully and remain committed.

essayModels.question: What can be done to reduce childhood obesity?

introduction.listing: These days, childhood obesity has become an increasingly serious problem in many countries.
introduction.opinion: It is widely recognised that this crisis affects children's health and future wellbeing significantly.
introduction.argument: Therefore, it is vital to identify the main problems and discuss effective solutions.

body.listing: Firstly, it seems that
body.opinion: unhealthy eating habits are a major cause of childhood obesity.
body.argument: This is because many children consume excessive amounts of sugary snacks and fast food daily. For example, many eat crisps and burgers regularly instead of nutritious meals. As a result, they consume far more calories than their bodies actually need.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: lack of physical exercise contributes significantly to rising obesity rates.
body.argument: This is because children spend hours on screens instead of playing outdoors actively. For instance, many prefer video games to sports or cycling. Consequently, fitness levels have declined sharply among young people.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: school education offers an effective solution to address this crisis.
body.argument: This is because schools can teach nutrition and provide healthy meals in canteens. For example, banning vending machines and increasing PE lessons would help considerably. By taking these steps, schools could reduce obesity.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: childhood obesity can be addressed through determined action.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that combining healthier diets, more exercise and school programmes will protect children's health.

essayModels.question: What are the causes and effects of social media addiction?

introduction.listing: In recent years, social media addiction has become a significant concern among young people.
introduction.opinion: It is widely acknowledged that excessive use has led to serious consequences for mental health.
introduction.argument: Hence, it is vital to examine the main causes and their resulting effects.

body.listing: To begin with, it seems that
body.opinion: One of the main causes of addiction is constant notifications from social media apps.
body.argument: This is because platforms are deliberately designed to send endless alerts about likes and messages. For example, each notification triggers dopamine release in the brain. As a result, users feel compelled to check their phones compulsively throughout the day.

body.listing: Secondly, it is generally argued that
body.opinion: Another important cause is social comparison with others online.
body.argument: This happens because people constantly see idealised images of others' seemingly perfect lives. For instance, teenagers compare themselves to influencers and celebrities. Consequently, feelings of inadequacy and low self-esteem develop rapidly.

body.listing: On the other hand, as far as I can judge
body.opinion: The effects on mental health are particularly serious and widespread.
body.argument: As a consequence, many young people experience anxiety, depression and loneliness. For example, constant comparison significantly damages self-confidence. Furthermore, addiction affects sleep quality and academic performance negatively.

conclusion.summary: All things considered, as far as I can judge,
conclusion.opinion: social media addiction causes serious problems for individuals.
conclusion.finalArgument: Despite some viewpoints expressed, it is clear that understanding these causes is essential for addressing this growing issue effectively.
